Old review: I love sandwiches. Unfortunately, Mr. Pickles is the closest sandwich shop to my work so I eat here from time to time. The quality of their meat seems to have improved since they first opened, but their bread is just stuff you'd buy off the shelf from Safeway. The kind that never molds or gets hard. In a city full of amazing bread this is a crime. 

These sandwiches are NOT made with love. I don't order the posted specials, so whatever I order, they get wrong every time.  Literally every time. I started to pre-write my order on paper so I could just hand it to them and cut down on one possible point of failure, and they still get it wrong.  Its almost comical.  I wonder, what will be missing from my sandwich today, the avocado, or the cheese?  Will I get mayo instead of mustard? The sandwich makers act like they are being forced to work their against their will, grumpy and slouching. 

If I have only 10 minutes to run grab something, I do go there, but it is depressing every time.
author: M M.

description:
great sando selections here! crazy ones too. I think they have the menu on-line somewhere, definitely worth checking out. Its next door to The total You where you can get a fine treatment (wax, facial) and a fatty sando!

Easy parking too!
author: Rachel L.

description: Look, I get that you're busy. You work fast and you make good sandwiches. You guys even have friendly attitudes.  But honestly, you need to work your online orders into your counter orders.  I ordered at 12:32pm, walked in at 12:55pm, and my sandwich had not even been made yet, and it's exactly three ingredients - bread, meat, cheese.   I live a block away, I visit often, and I want to save time by ordering online.  I don't want to order online, and then arrive for you to notice that, "oh, let's make your sandwich now".  You get paid for you time working. I get paid exactly nothing for my waiting.
author: John B.

description:
From the Pillsbury Doughboy, to Kool-Aid Man, to Noid the Zoid, for decades now our very way of life has rested upon the food mascots who have informed us not only which foods were nutritious, but which foods all the cool kids were eating.  But perhaps no food mascot is sweeter than Mr. Pickle.  Dude's packing condiments by the gallon, and his sombrero can't be beat.  Just look at him!

It should come as no surprise that an anthropomorphic pickle with such an amazing sense of style should also be a master in the kitchen.  Mr. Pickle tears it up in the culinary department, serving up sandwiches by the pound that are delicious like woah.  

Also, sometimes you can watch trashy MTV dating shows here, if that's what the sandwich makers have a hankering for watching.  But regardless of what's on the TV, you can rest assured that you will be dining upon a sandwich that truly rises above the rest.  

Perhaps best of all, for all you single ladies out there, it doesn't look like Mr. Pickle has a ring on that finger... so act quickly!  I can't imagine he'll be on the market for long.
author: Matt L.

description:
As an SF native and local, I have been to my share of sando joints and am rarely impressed. Mr. Pickles provides big 'ol portions and the prices aren't that bad (under $7 for a big sandwich in SF is a pretty good value). The ingredients taste fresh and their veggie sandwich is one of the only truly filling veggie sandwiches in the city. I have no qualms about placing Mr. Pickles in the top 5 sandwich shops in SF.

One minor con: it can get pretty busy - especially on weekends - so just keep that in mind when you are looking to stuff your fat face.
author: Victor W.

description:
Fat fat fat.
Cheap.
Tasty.
Pretty fast.

Don't like the deco at all (pretty depressing) but it's obviously a place for taking away.

Would totally recommand if you don't mind gaining a few hundred calories for lunch.
author: Mathilde B.

description: The Cesar Chavez is no doubt, one of the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life.
author: Sara G.

description: I cant go longer than a week without my Gaucho (Sandwich). This place is friendly, affordable, and, again, Im hooked on the Gaucho.
author: Philipp T.

description:
These things are huge!

Don't be overwhelmed with the wall menu. Gotta love dutch crunch rolls filled with meat and cheese! Small little place but we've taken our sandwiches to nearby house stoops. 

Take a picture with Mr Pickle (now that he has been returned after his kidnapping).
author: Anna R.

description:
That pickle cowboy standing in front of your shop looks like he wishes he had been born a jalapeo. Thank you for supporting his fantasy.

Your sandwiches are awesome, loaded with great fixings, and most importantly great quality kosher dills. You just can't beat a good pickle. I mean, unless you hate pickles. So for that, you rule. Crazy combinations are always a plus at a sandwich shop too. Big portions and quality meats add up to a great spot!
author: Ben R.

description:
Tonight's conversation went something like this.

ME:  When are you coming home?  I'm starving.  What should I cook?
GUY:  I am still working.
ME:  Ok, well I can't wait for you.  I don't feel like making something for myself.  Wait, what is this in the fridge?
GUY:  The other half of my Mr. Pickles sandwich.
ME;  Ok, whatever, I'll eat that.

I was so hungry tonight and in a moment of hunger weakness I devoured half a sandwich from Mr.  Pickles.  Huge amount of Italian deli meats on a dutch crunch roll (which I swear tasted deep fried, WHAT!).  Healthy?  Not by a long shot.  But really delicious.

If you eat the entire thing, you are a pig.  For sure.
author: Poker B.

description:
This sucker is HUGE. I like the Soprano, it's a solid sandwich. Throw in the extra buck and get a pickle, in fact it's often all I get. Note: Pickles are delivered on Tuesday and the pickle taste reflects the day of the week you get it on. Not much, but Tuesday or Wednesday is def. the day to go.

Not Super Impressed with the sandwich, but honestly, best sandwich shop in the mission that I've found yet.... Maybe in the city.
author: Tyler W.

description:
No Pickles at Mr. Pickles, how could that be?  I fully expected a nice dill pickle spear with my turkey, bacon with Swiss cheese sandwich. But no pickles at Mr. Pickles. For that off comes a star. This shop has no atmosphere; and for some reason the lady at the counter watches some strange program on the Discovery Channel about how toothpicks and other random items are made; but they are friendly and relatively efficient. But still I like to call ahead and get my sandwich to go. 

This shop represents something that our City needs more of, sandwiches, we have a real shortage of good solid sandwich shops in this town.
author: Seamus M.

description: Tried it out for the first time on a rainy-day excursion. Took a little while for being the only order in there, but the wait yielded a beast of a sandwich. I will be coming back.
author: Nate R.

description:
This place has a decent hot pastrami, but not worth a long trip to eat here. The use of pesto as a condiment help give their sandwiches a unique taste, but at times I was lamenting the huge portion. Also, I don't believe they think that there is ever too much mayo.

The price is decent, the food is good, the TV is TOO LOUD, and the decor is out of a hospital waiting room. I continue to eat here since its nearby with a rocking bandito pickle as a sign.
author: Geoffrey P.

description:
One of the best sandwich spots in the city.  The best in the Mission that I have found (aside from Tortas in some taquerias, I don't count those).

The breads are top notch. The meats are good too.  They have some crazy sandwich combos. They have some 'pesto spread' that goes on the sandwich.  They will toast any sandwich.

There is nothing not to love... wait... yea. there. is.

I hate pickles.  I use to see a chick that loved them... in fact.... they all loved pickles. I will not make out with you with in 20 minutes of you eating a pickle.  I really don't care how pretty you are.... I mean... hot... I only make out with hot chicks.

Sorry Mr. Pickles, you lose a star for that gigantic pickle outside that just looks to me like: FAILURE.
author: Thadd L.

description:
I used to frequent a Mr. Pickle in Sacramento when I lived there, so I was ecstatic when I discovered there was one mere blocks from where my boyfriend lives.  Their sandwiches are so yummy.  I can't eat an entire one in one sitting they're so stuffed with goodness.  I always get a simple turkey because they include so many other ingredients it doesn't seem all that simple in the long run.  They have many original sandwiches as well though with different combinations of ingredients.  The pesto spread that comes standard is the highlight of every sandwich.  That, and the pickles, of course.  Who could resist their adorable mascot?

My only complaint about this location is that they have a grand total of three places to sit.  You pretty much have to take your sandwich to go or hope no one else is enjoying theirs there.  Also, sometimes they have their television at an annoying volume.
author: Laura W.

description:
I have no problem making a trip all the way across the city just to get a sandwich from this place - they're amazing.

For under $10 you get to choose from a huge menu full of delicious options which are totally unique to Mr.Pickle's restaurants.  I'm normally a traditional (boring) Turkey sandwich kind of guy, but I swear they must put crack on their sandwiches because I have yet to try one that I don't like. 

Another thing that's awesome about this place: I *hate* pickles, and they don't ever give me shit for asking the employees to make my sandwich without them! The first time I asked, I pictured someone saying in a loud voice (maybe with a new york accent) "NO PICKLES ON YOUR MR. PICKLES SANDWICH??!!!." 

Delicious, cheap, and filling sandwiches. Thank you Mr. Pickles.
author: Isaac W.

description:
yummy yummy yummy. 5 of us went and we all got the veggie. It was so good. I ate half for dinner and then the other half after coming home from dancing all night. It was a great late night snack. The pesto is great.

There aren't any tables or chairs to sit and eat in, so it seems it may just be a "to go" place.
author: Ashley E.

description:
vegetarian BLT.

holy crap it is amazing.

there are no words.


also, online delivery.
author: Lily S.

description:
Absolutely go to Mr. Pickle's for an awesome lunch!  Their sandwiches are amazing, all melted and delicious and huge and perfect in every way.
But you should also go to Mr. Pickle's for a real SF neighborhood experience.  Diyana, aka "Mama Pickle" will watch out for your car if the DPT is near, and will hold packages for the people in the apartment building, and keep the street clean and safe out front, all the while telling you a joke and taking care of business. She's awesome!  Stop by and say hi!  Her son Elias is behind the counter, taking charge of making your lunch experience the absolute bomb, every time.  
I love Mr. Pickle's!!
author: Aidan K.

description:
Things I love about Mr. Pickles: 
Best Meatball Sandwich I've had in the City, in fact one of the best ever, aside from Paradiso's in San Jose. 
Best Random Signage: A Cowboy Pickle?!
Friendly phone service

Things I don't love: it takes forever if you don't call ahead - but, don't be a jerk - just call ahead and it's all good.
author: Carla G.

description:
My favorite sandwich shop in the Mission. Have been going here ever since I moved to the neighborhood. My personal favorite is a turkey and salami on dutch crunch with swiss everything hot! I love the pesto sauce so much. 

owner is also very nice. she always flows me a buck instead of making change. I highly recommend Mr. Pickle
author: Alejandro M.

description: Well the Pickles in the jar on the counter Rocked my world....but the sandwich did not. Bread to meat ratio bad, shredded lettuce bad, lady behind counter adorable. I'll be back for the pickle.
author: Hidegrl A.

description:
Good things take time - and the good sandwich from Mr. Pickles take time.  The hot stays hot, the cold stays cold, and the bread gets toasted (twice!).  The topping is plentiful (the pickles are quite good) - and pesto is a nice touch.

It's a gigantic sandwich, as mentioned in the other reviews.  But I have had a female friend who's put down 1.5 sandwiches in one sitting.

Next time you go, pick up a handy paper menu.  For future visits, call your order in, have your change ready, and you are in/out in no time.  For those of you looking for a quick fix, be warned that the sandwich making could be very slow - but then again, good things take time.
author: Hanson L.

description: Peanut sauce on my sandwich?  Sprouts and teriyaki sauce too?  The "Hipster" sandwich (despite the god-awful name) is by far one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  It was a beautiful experience.
author: Rachelle P.

description: My favorite sandwich place thus far.  Their Pesto sauce...mmm
author: Lia N.

description:
If your starving and/or potentially up for a food coma, their sandwiches are pretty amazing.  old school sub sandwiches.  
The place pretty small, literally 2 seats, so plan on eating it somewhere else.
I left the house with only 5 bucks in my pocket and was able to get the cheese/vege sandwich, and it lasted me lunch-dinner.
author: Ashley P.

description:
1 hour wait for a sandwich - oh hell no!

Went there today for a 'quick' bite. There were a few people in line - and then those who had ordered online which made things take much longer. But what really got to me was how people who were in line after me me got their sandwiches before - a lot before almost 15 minutes. When I brought this up to the worker he gave some lame excuse about meat cooking (uh its deli meat dude - its already cooked).

To top it off - they left off the avocado! The best part of a turkey avocado sandwich.

Will not be going back!
author: Sara M.

description: I'm not a fan of Mr Pickles, and its probably because their brand of sandwiches just does not suit me at all. I've been to a lot of sandwich shops in the city and we felt like this just isn't the place for us. When we went, we had roast beef sandwiches on sour dough, same sandwich i get every where else, quality isn't there and a little pricey for a sandwich.
author: Rio A.

description:
I can't believe I haven't Yelped Pickles yet. Yeah, that's right, we call it Pickles around the office... the "Mister" requires too much effort.

Anyhoo, they used to have Tootsie Roll pops free with your sandwich. Now they have cheap-ass round pediatrician's-office knockoff lollipops. It's revolutionized my Pickles experience, and not in the good way. Kind of like the 2000 election.

The sandwiches themselves are large and in charge. I'm a fan of the mortadella sandwich (with ONE INCH OF MEAT! Perhaps the only instance where I would exclaim that with joy instead of disappointment), toasted on sourdough, for those days when you feel like a fatass and embrace it.

In conclusion, I heart Mr. Pickles. When they bring back the Tootsie Roll pops, they'll get that elusive fifth star.

UPDATE 2/5/07: The Tootsie Roll Pops are back, bitches!
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Huge, Giant size sandwiches.

These are made for the guys, but let's look at it this way ladies.......we can have half for lunch and the other half for dinner.  Never mind sharing with your honey!  Make him get his own sammy.

I *Heart* the Tony Soprano sandwich.
author: Emmy d.

description: YUM YUM! Mr. Pickles is so delicious...I rather get this over Ike's any day of the week! Cheaper, just as good, and NO LINE! Allegedly Ike used to work at Mr. Pickles, and that is where he got the sandwich idea, Ike just put more outrageous sandwich options and raised up the prices. All the Mr. Pickles sandwiches are pretty good, but get it on Dutch bread! YUM. The owners are really nice too. She gave us free lolipops!
author: alexandria g.

description:
The City is seriously lacking in good sandwich shops. I think Mr. Pickles may be one of the best, or maybe I just miss having a deli on every corner??  The Gaucho and the Veggie are both fantastic, the service is always quick and their pickles are amazing! (go figure!) There's not much seating in the restaurant so plan on getting your sandwich to go, and definitely make sure you get one of their pickles, they're delivered on Tuesdays, so hit them up when they're fresh!

I just wish someone would open a good sandwich shop in Russian Hill!
author: Craig E.

description:
I've moved away from the Mission (thank god) but still go back to Mr. Pickles every once in a while to get the Caesar Chavez sandwich. I get mine *light* pesto and pepperjack cheese instead of swiss.

It can get a little hipster heavy so I'd recommend calling in the order 10 min before and getting it to go. Ultimate in and out.
author: Brian H.

description:
I'm into pickles to such an extent that I was unimpressed by the pickle content of my sandwich. It was pretty good, but if a joint called itself Peanut Butter Man's, replete with a mascot outside that's half-man/half-jar-of-peanut-butter, a fool might come to expect some peanut butter on sandwiches, and plenty of it. So throw some more dill chips at me. That's all I'm saying.

There is a dearth of big (non-torta, non-burger) sandwiches in the Mission. You've got Lucca's, Bi-Rite and a very few others. So there's Mr. Pickles. It's a big sandwich, oozing with, um, condiments. Which it's mascot brandishes from holsters. 

One thing I wasn't prepared for is they splooge pesto sauce on everything. Seriously. It's on the menu. I tell ya, pesto ain't onions, but the next time I roll into Mr Pickles, I'm saying, hold 'em both.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
As a toasted sandwich lover I have become addicted to this place. Their turkey with avocado on whatever bread is always great. The only drawbacks are that their stools aren't high enough and the TV is always blaring. Last time it was Forrest Whitaker's wife talking about how she loves bargains (fuck you byatch).

Great toasted 'witches but next time I'm gettin' 'em to go.
author: Mark G.

description:
Truly truly one of the best values around. Every time I get a sandwich here, I have been pleased. The price is right and the owners are super friendly in this no frills joint. Don't plan on eating there, but for take out you can't ask for more!

Tony Soprano is my personal favorite on dutch crunch.
author: Matt C.

description:
holy fuck .so yesterday I was a) sad from a situation on friday b) pms'ing so hard I cried watching ICONOCLASTS:Maya Angelou and Dave Chappelle on Sundance channel c) it was super rainy. I was a motherfucking mess,kinda like Anna Nicole Smith(rip) mess. I needed a sandwich. I remembered I had seen a mr pickles on s.van ness once, and thats a popular chain that is in my hometown too.

Can we say just what the doctor ordered? I got a THE GAUCHO that was chicken breast doused in buffalo hot sauce and then all the fixings.

Thank you mr.pickles for helping me thru a horrible day.BESOS
author: Lauren V.

description:
Definitely not a place to sit down and eat--just get your food from the smart ass sandwich makers and go out into the sunny Mission.  And I strongly recommend the chicken salad sandwich...all white meat, with or without cheese and all kinds of veggies and condiments.  Add a couple of salt and vinegar potato chips to the sandwich and you're in lunchy lala land.

My vote on the outdoor mascot:  Winner.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
This is a damn good sandwich!  They have a large selection of specialty subs, including BBQ, meatballs, pastrami, and just about anything else that you can think of.  The sandwiches are huge and could probably make two meals if you aren't starving.  

Their ambiguously racist Mr. Pickle mascot is priceless.  It kinda looks like the love child of the 3 Amigos and an old cucumber.  

Now the bad:  My sandwich was $6.49.  My total bill for the sandwich and a Vitamin Water was $10.  Me thinks me sees where the margins be at. 

So for all you sandwich-philes out there, if you happen to be in the area, this place is definitely worth a visit.
author: matt c.

description: Dog house was pretty decent. Pastrami had a good amount of flavor. Bread was a bit hard for sourodough but maybe I'll try a different bread next time.
author: Eric R.

description:
Walked there this morning, a drizzly day. Was needing a good hangover sandwich and decided to try this place out.  Was presently surprised by two guys working. They were super nice and helpful AND treated us to tootsie roll pops.

Got home and could only eat half, the sandwich was so huge! Got the veggie no cheese. Mmm Mmm good. 

Oh and very sad to here about Mr Pickles. I'm thinking we start mass posts/blogs to find him and bring him home!!
author: Emily V.

description: These sandwiches are really good. I've tried the Station 7, the Hipster, and the Gaucho and they were all good. There are 31 options and you can customize. Two things to consider: 1) cash only 2) call ahead or the wait will be long.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Pickle Cowboy! How can you pass this place up? A life-size (albeit short) pickle with a 10-gallon stetson and two six-shooters. My friend who introduced me to Mr. Pickles just loves that sign. 

The sandwiches are fantastic. First off, they are huge. It takes a large person to finish one. Smaller folks like me can easily split one with a lover, friend, or enemy.

Last night we had a turkey, ham and salami sandwich. The meat was excellent. I'm not usually a fan of salami, but this was delicious. The melted cheese was so tasty too. The toppings are all fresh, and the bread was perfect (get it toasted!)  It's not a cheap sandwich (around $7), but it's totally worth the price. It's more food than a Subway footlong, and so much better. 

The staff are very friendly also. You must go.
author: J S.

description:
I was seriously impressed with the size of my tasty sandwich from Mr. Pickle's Sandwich Shop.  Unfortunately, it was very, very messy.  I can recommend this place, but I would advise against trying to eat one of these monsters while driving.  By the time I got to Half Moon Bay, my pants were drenched in the buffalo wings sauce that was an integral part of my chicken sandwich.

Also, be warned that it's common to spend 15-20 minutes waiting for your sandwich to be prepared because it can get really busy around lunch and this place rightfully is seen as a great deal.  Parking can usually be had nearby, but plan on putting three quarters in the meter because you're likely to be waiting for about that amount of time if you arrive between 11:30 - 1:00.
author: Lucius M.

description:
My friends and I are in this huge sandwich phase of our lives right now, so obviously we had to visit. We even looked up the menu online so we'd be prepared to order one of these massive sandwiches. Seriously, they're the size of a small puppy, and not too expensive. Love it. 
Anyway, I got a Cesar Chavez, which contains all the perfect ingredients that a sandwich should have: chicken, bacon, avocado and jack cheese.. add on the complimentary pesto, mayo and veggies and you're in sandwich heaven. 
Excellent. The nice lady who took my order was awesome, too. Definitely coming back.
author: Tabby R.

description:
Okay, I have to admit, I wasn't really looking forward to going to a sandwich place called Mr. Pickles.  But someone was buying me lunch, so who am I to be hella picky right?

We find parking immediately and I wasn't too sure how to feel about that being in San Francisco (I mean, really, do you ever find parking right away?  Is that a good sign of a business?).  We walk in (keep in mind it was about 1PM, so I assume there would be customers there before us) and there were NO ONE THERE.  Not looking good.  

Not to sound racial, but this look like one of the most "white-washed" sandwich place I have ever seen in the Mission yet there were two latin fellas listening to soft Latin Rock behind the counter.  That was totally unexpected.

I finally figured out what I wanted to eat, the TONY SOPRANO.  We get back to our workplace and I looked at my sandwich and the first thought was "DAMN, pretty big, lots of meat, my kinda sandwich".  I took that first bite and thought "DAMN, not too shabby Mr. Pickle, not too shabby at all"

Now, will I find myself craving a Mr. Pickles Sandwich?  Prolly not since I know of better places, but I'm glad I was able to experience it.  

Price is pretty reasonable, service pretty good, and the sandwiches are pretty good also.

This has been another Mike Vuong PSA!!
author: Mike V.

description:
will all the new nattering nabobs of negativity putting down the pickle quit the hyperbole?  one-star people, really?  really??  

you boobs nattering about how Ike's rocks and how the pickle is so ghetto, yada yada yada, you've compelled me to write this update.   man, you just don't get it, do you?  this isn't some city-wide contest or beauty pageant.  the pickle is about knowing you can stroll in whenever you're hungry and haven't got much cash,  and only a truly superb sandwich with a tootsie roll pop and genuinely friendly service no matter the time or day or day of week is gonna cut it.  everybody wants a sando place like this around the corner. 

the pickle is about being able to get your simple ingredients inside the best sourdough roll ever.  (whatever you get, be sure to order yours on sourdough, toasted.)  the Gaucho, extra spicy, is still my personal favorite.  But find your own.
author: Nikki F.

description: Awesome sandwiches, always made to order fresh ingridients, friendly faces, just an awesome place to get a sandwich
author: Pedro C.

description: I first discovered Mr. Pickles in the Dublin/Pleasanton area and loved it.  I found the one on 20th and South Van Ness in S.F. and couldn't wait to go there.  What a disappointment.  The place was skanky and dirty.  The sandwich was excellent and because of the huge size, it's the only thing I ate that day.  I woke up in the middle of the night with severe stomach cramps and spent the entire rest of the night in the bathroom off and on.  Never again.
author: Kathy T.

description: i think it was the chicken honey mustard sandwich or something.  the taste was amazing, but as i was eating it, i started wondering, is this canned chicken?  cuz it tastes like canned chicken (the texture).  didnt care for the meat part, but it tasted good.
author: Sage S.

description:
Today is April the 18th, 2007.

I dont know why i have not taken 2 hours of my day to write a review yet for this place. Today is the day, Mark it YELP, MARK IT!. 

The price is right, the sammich is generous, for less than 7 bucks you can get a mean sandwich with a rare name to reference it, kind of like THE LARRY DAVID- filled with Capers and a white Cod.  Im still waiting for that one, but even if your less adventurous, get a regular turkey sandwich, all i have to say is, Your gonna return.
author: Joe J.

description:
Not the best Mr. Pickle's I've been to. They still make a kick a kick ass sangweech but the 'ambience' is a bit lack luster. There's no where to sit except a gluttenously high bar with too short stools that just put your face level with the counter top. I guess that's supposed to be good so then you could just shovel the sandwich directly into your mouth without even having to hold it, but I'm a Carl's Jr. motto kind of person and I like it when it gets all over the place. 

My friend and I were the only people in there at about 2pm on a weekday, I'm kind of baffled how they stay open. If I had a choice I would drive to the Mr. Pickle's in Daly City instead of taking the bus to this much closer one. The Daly City one might have a creepy gimp who works the register, but its way nicer and there's places to sit.
author: bo h.

description: I always get either the Tom Tom (turkey, bacon, and swiss) or the Meatball, on dutch crunch, toasted, with everything. These two are so good, I can't bring myself to try anything else. It's all I can do to pass up one of them. The pesto-based house spread (part of the "everything") takes every sandwich to the next level. It's delicious and cheap, the guys behind the counter are chill and polite, and they give you a lollipop for dessert.
author: Marco L.

description:
I have just two words for you. Peppers. And pesto. I am a wuss when it comes to all things hot, but the peppers make the sammie. I live a mere five blocks from here and have not frequented it nearly enough. So, I'm working on this extended weekend and had a hankerin' for a sandwich while I toiled away at my computer. So, I looked up Mr. Pickle's to see if they were open, and sure enough, they're on in full force on Sunday. I walked down there and they were packed with people, which is a good sign. I believe a street fair is on Mission today, but still. I got the house combo with ham, salami and turkey with everything, including peppers and pesto. When I got back home with my prize, I inhaled that sucker. That is one of the best sandwiches I've had in a long time. I had forgotten about this amazing shop, but no more. I have a sense it will be my staple go-to soon. Fresh bread, shredded lettuce and good meat. I highly recommend it. 

Oh, and if you know the whereabouts of Mr. Pickle, please alert the authorities....

http://missionmission.wordpress.com/2009/03/15/breaking-mr-pickle-stolen/
author: Michael E.

description: Ordered a pickup for 9 people. It was ready on time, which I always am a huge fan of. I ordered the Tony Soprano and it was fantastic. They only take cash but I can't really take away a star for that.
author: Chas B.

description: I called up Mr. Pickle on my telephone and a woman answered. I assume it was Mr. Pickle's wife. I ordered one of their chicken sandwiches because I love chicken so much.  Mrs. Pickle said to me, "We have to close because we are out of bread." I said, "But I don't like bread, I like chicken." I later discovered bread is necessary to make this particular type of sandwich. I am going to KFC where things make sense.
author: Dinner Dog X.

description:
One of the best....if not THE BEST....sandwich shops in the city. The sandwiches are huge -- Mr. Pickles doesn't skimp on any of the ingredients. Plus, the staff is very nice -- they sometimes even give you a free lollipop to show their appreciation.

The best part of Mr. Pickles? The sign out front. Go there to see for yourself.
author: Dave S.

description:
I'm a sucker for a good deli, and they are hard to find in SF.  I've lived right around the corner from this place for a long time and finally, finally made it in to get a sandwich.  What a trip!

me: I really like the Mr. Pickles outside, he's a nice addition to the neighborhood.

Diyana: Isn't he cute? I love him.  All the kids like Mr. Pickles, they walk by going home from school and say hi to Mr. Pickles.

me: nobody ever messes with him?

Diyana: Why would they want to hurt Mr. Pickles?  Nobody hurt Mr. Pickles.  I kill them.

Just enough time for banter while the skilled craftsman makes our to-go order in the background.  If it hadn't been a week ago I would remember the names of the two sandwiches, but mine was a pastrami and swiss, my girlfriend had something with chicken on it, both with the works (yummy pesto!), and both fantastic.

Thanks Mr. Pickles for reminding me that I need to check out more places that are a short walk from my house!
author: Matthew D.

description: I love this place. One of the best Sandwich place in Mission. The guy is so great. He gives cool recommendation. I try visit every week.
author: Kapil D.

description: this place is sick.  goldmine as it is 14 steps from my door.  tony soprano is what you would think - salami and motadella and a bunch of other italian loveness....fuhgettduhaboutit
author: Rob C.

description: Sandwiches are good, on par with the Safeway Primo Taglio goodness. There isn't much space to eat inside; plan on grabbing to go.
author: Rob T.

description: get the tony soprano on dutch crunch
author: Doug H.

description:
My favorite is the Reggie - chicken on dutch crunch.  I always think I'm getting something half-way healthy, but then when I'm done my hands are completely covered in oil.  The turkey on sourdough with cranberry sauce is good too.

Employees are friendly and not ass kissers. And everything is made fresh but still pretty fast.

Mr. Pickle is a half-pickle-half-man/cowboy with a handsome mustache who greets visitors with a smile.
author: Carlos V.

description:
Initially intimidated by the large and heavily-armed, Sombrero-flaunting security with the perpetual smile, we decided to circle the block a couple times to patronize this silly themed Sandwich shop.  

Fledgling vegetarian, I could not resist the honey-mustard chicken temptation that is the last Sandwich on the menu; its epic name escapes my memory.  My partner chose the only vegetarian selection and we waited.  

The end result were two over-endowed Sandwiches, successful in their execution.  Though not very creative in their presentation, they were tasty and virtually endless in contents spilling out of the yeasty flanks of custom selected bread.  

I'm 6'3", and the two stools available to sit at the window made me feel like Lil' Bush.  19:1 Meat to Vegetarian selection leaves room for innovation.   I'm sure Mr. Pickles does enough business with omnivores and relapse-prone veg-diet enthusiasts.   And people who like to stand whilst they eat.  Thanks, Mr. Pickles.
author: Erik O.

description:
Though the original Mr. Pickles in San Mateo is in my top 5 sandwich places, this specific location takes a close second to the flagship.  They have all the same specialty sandwiches, and make them just about as good, though they have different names.  My personal favorite is the "Padre's Pride" or as it's known in S.F. the "Cesar Chavez";   MMMMMMM.....roasted chicken, bacon and avocado with melted jack on a sourdogh roll, i'm tellin'ya kids, it don't get much better than that.
i'd probably give 5 stars if the original wasn't sooo damn good.
author: Carol S.

description:
The Cesar Chavez is one of my favorite sandwiches in the city. Chicken, provolone, bacon, avo, with a pesto mayo. Mmmmm....
Also, the staff are friendly and they have a TV to watch sports while waiting for your order.
author: Daniel K.

description: Good sandwiches can be hard to find... but not at Mister Pickle. The staff are friendly and funny, and the sandwiches are amazing. I'd put them on a sandwich pedestal close to Ike's Place. Great bread, great sauces, great ingredients, and it is all toasted to perfection. I recommend grabbing your food to go, however as the seating leaves a bit to be desired... but that's okay, you're really going for the food.
author: Christopher V.

description: This place is awesome. Vege is great. Service lovely. Only place in the mission that's told me to bring my bike inside instead of leaving it on the street.
author: Wade M.

description:
Working in the Mission, my coworkers and I daily rotate where we get lunch take out... We order from Mr. Pickles at least once a week...(when I first discovered this shop, I think it was twice that week) Delicious!! I would never ever be able to finish one sandwich to myself so my coworker and I share the Cesar Chavez and we are only left satisfied. Their bread is delicious. Their pesto spread is delicious. 
mmmm....think i'll go tomorrow for lunch
author: Jessica Y.

description:
its...okay. 
the woman who works at the one near mission is a doll. very nice lady.  but the sandwiches lack a bit flaor. maybe its the bread... i think i crave the fresh baked flavor of ike's. but if you like a sandwich that is a lot tastier than an average sub,  this is good place to go .
author: Katie C.

description: I'm a sucker for a big ass sandwich...and I just love eating them! After walking through "Sunday Streets" in the Mission it was time for a snack before heading to the symphony at Dolores Park. This place is awesome because there are so many options to choose from! I chose the veggie sandwich: comes with everything including pesto! Yum!!! It was huge and I ate the whole thing...all by myself! Satisfying and wanting more...can't wait to come back and try other things on their menu...staff is friendly and you can't go wrong with the price!
author: Mel P.

description:
Who ever does not love Mr. Pickles must be crazy!!! Talk about a yummy sandwich, this is the place. Not only that but it is way clean in there. O.K. I noticed they got 100% on the health dept rating. I bet you could eat off the floor in there but I think I'd rather dig into the food
Enjoy!!
author: lorri l.

description:
Here's a good litmus test for any dining establishment's food quality. If you see cops eating there, chances are, it's pretty good. That's what drew me to Mr. Pickles. 

Their sandwiches are HUGE and tasty. I'm partial to the pastrami, but I also stuff my face with the chicken salad frequently. It's gotten to the point where I am always asked "chicken salad today?" by the staff when I saunter in for a late lunch.

And let's talk about the staff. They are some of the nicest folks you'd ever meet. Always friendly, have never gotten my order wrong once, no matter how complicated I decide I want my sandwich that day.

They have a huge assortment of specialty sandwiches, but if you want a simple ham on dutch, they can make that too, with their fantastic pickles and pesto dressing.

Just be sure to wear a rain slicker, because some of those sandwiches can be quite messy. ("The Bear" and "Station 7" come to mind.)
author: Jonny P.

description: The sandwiches here are amazing. The bread is soooo good. I love the tuna sandwich here and my boyfriend loves every sandwich on the menu. This is *the* place for a deli sandwich in our neighborhood. Sadly, the famous Mr. Pickle sign was recently stolen from outside. I have my fingers crossed the culprit will return the Mission's beloved Mr. Pickle.
author: Veronica J.

description: Two meals in one sandwich.  They load on the toppings.  Only a few barstools, so get it to go.
author: Christina S.

description: I am a vege-"except for the once a month when I visit Mr Pickles for a (now not so very ) secret turkey sandwich with cranberry sauce on toasted wheat, hold the mayo, onions, and peppers"-tarian. Yum. No shame.
author: Hallie R.

description: Ok, their stupid hours of business aside I have to bump them up a star for their Dog House sandwich. They do go a little crazy with the lettuce though.
author: Manny F.

description: The metric by which all other sandwiches are evaluated. Simple as that.
author: Haz O.

description: I had no idea Mr. Pickles was a chain restaurant considering how low profile this location is. The pastrami sandwich tops my personal favorites list. Not for shrinking violets, it is a large mound of meaty-Swiss-cheesy goodness. Yesterday I picked a vegetarian sandwich, and it was delicious. Avocados?? Yes!! The bread rolls run a little tough. I wonder if they can improve that.
author: Evelyn B.

description: Giant sandwiches, with everything you could imagine on them, the oozing kind. I love the pickle sign, but not the blaring TV or the nondescript decor. For boys with big appetites,  it's apparently sandwich heaven. Personally, I prefer my food on a smaller scale.
author: Stellah D.

description: Mr. Pickles is tasty and nice.  Their sandwiches runneth over with abundant, flavorful filling.  We ordered a Station 7 on sliced wheat and a meatball sandwiche on dutch crunch, complete with sour cream and onion chips.  I ate half, saved the other half, and gobbled it up as an afternoon snack.  Still tasty after sitting around for 2 hours.  At about $8 a person, this place is one special sandwiche shop.  Plus, that pickle guy out front makes me giggle every time.  It's a pickle wearing a sombrero!  That's funny!  Well, I think so.  I'm easily amused.
author: Diana Y.

description: Not really sure what people are raving about.  Yes they have different types of sandwiches than a grocery store deli counter, but they weren't all that.  It tasted like a regular sandwich.  The sandwich wasn't as big as I was expecting after reading the reviews.   I mean when I pay over 6 bucks for a sandwich it better be big.  A few days later I had Mr. Pickles again.  Same experience.  The sandwich was decent enough, but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to come here.  But if in the neighborhood and in the mood for a sandwich, I'd stop by.
author: Isi C.

description: I went there hoping for the kind of subs you can get back east.  No luck there, but the sandwiches you can get are fantastic.  Do yourself a favor and tell the cashier what you absolutely don't want on your sandwich.   Otherwise be prepared to answer a dozen questions as they prepare your food: did you want mayo?  Pesto?  Hummus on that pastrami?  Still, once you survive the interrogation, you've got enough sandwich to feed a family of five.  They've got a couple of seats, but it's more for waiting than for eating; I've only ever taken my food to go.
author: Christian C.

description: Excellent!  Mr Pickle's is a little out of my way but sometime I just get a craving for the Station 7 sandwich.  I hate places that skimp out on the meat and topping, you won't find that here the sandwiches are huge and they don't skimp out on anything.  They are always nice and if you order by phone your order will be ready in no time.
author: Michael G.

description: Best damn sandwhich in a long time. God this was good. The prices are quite reasonable and the wait was short. No five stars because the place was kind of dumpy looking and it really didn't look all that clean. Otherwise, everything was quite delicious. Will definitely eat here again.
author: Adam P.

description: A co-worker talked me into getting lunch here... fantastic aoli, great bread, fresh ingredients, one sandwich is large enough for 2 people.  Def goin back soon.
author: Bin M.

description: I'm gonna talk about work related dives for a bit here... Mr. Pickle; is across the street from the most amazing Mexican eatery in the mission, and it holds its own in terms of  "sandwich". I worked down here for a year and would frequent Mr. Pickle with some regularity with my cohorts, and honestly, the pastrami, etc are all outstanding. freshly made with melted cheese (not kosher), and bold flavors. In true eBay form: highly recommend. A++++++++
author: Adam X.

description: My first bite was the tell all--the roast beef had an aged taste to it and not in a good way. I think since I ordered it with everything, I was able to ignore that taste for a few more bites, but in the end, I could not eat the damn thing. It is a bummer too since it is the closest place to grab a quick sando from my work. I may try it again and order something different, but only time will tell.
author: Deborah S.

description: I had an americano and an egg sandwich.  The americano was pretty bad, even considering that the woman working there explained to me she was lousy at making coffee.  The egg sandwich was iffy, the prescrambled eggs came in a folded sheet from a tupperware from the fridge and were microwaved.  All in all I would try it again but I definitely wouldn't order an egg sandwich here.  This is not a breakfast or coffee place.
author: Matt N.

description: Really nice place. Portions are liberal - sometimes enough for two meals - and price is right. Always a tasty sandwich.
author: Zac w.

description: OH MY GOD!  I'm almost one hundred percent sure that this place IS THE best place to get a more than spectacular sandwich in this city.  Or perhaps even in the world.  The sandwiches are to f-ing die for!  I always get the veggie, with avocado (VERY important) and pepper jack cheese.  Dude...its the kind of food, where you take a bite...look at your friend...and you both just smile and nod for about 30 seconds.  Delicious.  Spectacular is a better word for it.  And the staff are all pretty amazing.  Friendly and super awesome.  This place should get a crown.
author: Amy T.

description: The guys are always arguing with each other. About what their mother told them to do or if the mayo is still good. They cut their chatter to stare like they've never seen a woman before even though I know my friend who lives upstairs goes there all the time and she is female. THEN they call me ma'am.  Hilarious!
author: Krismet C.

description: I kept being tempted by the big friendly pickle on the sidewalk, during my drive to work in the mornings.  Finally after reading Derek D.'s review, I decided to try it out. It's definitely not most inviting decor, but they had some creative sandwiches on the menu.  I opted for the Vegi plus turkey (I know defeats the purpose of a vegi sandwich, but it was easier to order it this way then turkey plus all the veggies.).  The sand which was pretty good...I'd eat there again...but I have to say I was a little disappointed that there was no deli pickle on the side...something I kind of expected with a name like Mr. Pickles Sandwich Shop.
author: Amy C.

description: Had the Cesar Chavez sandwich: chicken breast, bacon, avocado, on Dutch bread. Approved. Love the sombreroed Mr Pickle outside.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Dig this sandwiches here...dig the details of Mr. Pickle's kidnapping...sometimes they give you free blow-pops.
author: Elle N M.

description: Really didn't want to like this place. Kind of out of the way, the lady overcharged me for the sandwich, they don't carry baked chips, don't accept credit cards, and wanted an extra $1.50 for a pickle. So I passed on the pickle, picked up chips elsewhere, and headed to my spot at Dolores Park. I thought on the walk over the weight of the bag was due to the soda can. As I discovered, and the reason why this is a four star review, is because the sandwich is so freaking big. They piled on so much turkey, mixed in some cranberry, veggies, and slammed it all together on whole grain bread. Mmmm, delicious.
author: Jason B.

description: Mr. Pickles, you're the one; you make lunchtime so much fun! He's almost as cute as Rubber Ducky, wearing that giddy sombrero and packing all that heat for the kiddies to play with. Their sandwich size fits a large man with a healthy appetite, but they also offer half orders for the pipsqueaks (like me). Or you can share with a friend. The meatballs are yum. My boring but satisfying go-to is turkey provolone avocado. The Mr. isn't worthy enough to even kiss Sub Center's left pinkie toe, but it's a good start for this part of the Mission. I was inclined to give them three stars, but the zany mascot bumped it up to four. Gumby ain't got nothin' on you.
author: Katrina D.

description:
I don't think words can express how much I love the Mr. Pickles cut out that stands on 20th and South Van Ness. Mr. Pickles looks like he's about to make his move in a showdown. He has a big sombrero and a thick dark mustache. He's got a sandwich under one arm and carries mustard and mayonnaise in his holsters. His bullet holder has peppers instead bullets. He wears cowboy boots on his little pickle feet. Really he should be called Senor Pickles, but Mr. Pickles answers to no one. Mr. Pickles makes me feel safe. I feel like he's protecting the street. What harm could befall me while Mr. Pickles is on the beat?
Having said all that, I've only been there once. I'm not sure about the price since it was on work. There's very little seating, a counter and some stools. The sandwiches were pretty good. The one time I went in there all workers looked like dopey hooligans. Big teen-aged boys who were joking around a lot. I liked that. Mr. Pickles is a small Bay Area chain, and each place names their sandwiches something different. I found this slightly confusing when picking up the order I placed.
I suppose this review isn't too helpful, but really it's all about Mr. Pickles himself. Mr. Pickles! I squeal with delight each time I see him.
author: Daniella C.

description: After eating one of their huge ham sandwiches I was sure I had taken a year off of my life expectancy.  Every time my roommate eats there he has to take a three hour siesta.
author: David A.

description: I would just like to point out that other people are beginning to catch on to my theory: http://missionmission.wordpress.com/2009/05/15/mr-pickle-refurbed-and-redeployed/
author: Liz W.

description: Probably the messiest sandwich I've ever eaten (I like the turkey with cranberry sauce) but completely worth it.  Friendly service, hearty sandwiches, fresh and tasty.
author: Julie R.

description: For big, heavy, hot sandos that drip all over and stuff you silly.  Got the one vegetarian option which was a mass of melted jack/cheddar, sprouts, iceberg, pickles, cucumbers, mayo and pesto on a perfectly pressed crispy wheat roll.  Not 5-star scrumptious but definitely fatso satisfying.
author: Melanie C.

description:
how can you even care about the food when the pickle outside has a holster of condiments??  a holster of condiments!!!

but if you do care - the sandwiches are good, although the dudes inside who make them move at the pace of a very slow snail.    

also, try the peanut butter cookies.  you won't regret it!
author: Sharon M.

description: Not as good as the one in San Mateo on El Camino Real... but close... and still the best sandwich in the city (READ: THE BAR IS SET REALLY LOW).  I am a big fan of the Ceasar Chavez as any sandwich with chicken, avacado, and swiss is heaven in my book, the Padre's Pride from the San Mateo Location (the original) is better.  I stop off here to get food for beach trips or ball games and every time am glad I did.   Get to go and call in your order if you can, the wait can be quite long.
author: Darren R.

description: This place is a block from my house and for some reason off my radar because I just went there for the first time recently... Boy have I been missing out! I got one of the most rockin' sandwiches I've had in a long time. Mortadella with melted swiss cheese, good bread, pesto and peppers make it messy in a good way. Perfect for a picnic at the beach (which is what we did) - or anytime you need good grub really.
author: Aimee G.

description: This place used to be a staple of my lunchtime eating when I worked in the US bank tower on 22nd and mission.  The sandwitches arent horribly cheap but they are big and tasty...The soprano on dutch crunch is simply killer and a real meal and a half for most of us normal folk...the service is fast and friendly and the chip and drink selection is pretty damn good as well.  I'm a fan of mr. pickles and all of the other mission kids are as well!
author: Francis K.

description: We stop here usually on our way out of town...either for a trip to the resevoir or to a concert etc to pick up sammies for the road. Really good, huge and yummy.
author: Adrienne G.

description: They make a pretty good sandwich here but I'm partial to the location down in Daly City since I've eaten there more and only once here.  I think they are pretty much the same.
author: Derek D.

description: In my opinion Mr. Pickles has the best sandwiches in the city.  Featuring tons of meat, fresh bread, and pesto spread onto every sandwich they make these bad boys offer a huge sandwich with a lot of flavor.  Try the Tony Soprano (it features just about every meat in existance that ends in a vowel) or my #1 pick the Pastrami with Bacon and get your daily reccmmended allowance of nitrates.
author: matthew w.

description: I finally ate here, mostly b/c of the big pickle out front- he's sexy! I had the BLT with most of the condiments, which is pretty out of the oridnary. Usually I only want BLT with a little mayo but was delicious! I have to go back and try some different ones- they all looked pretty good. Plus its impossible to find a sandwich in that area.
author: Jane K.

description: Fairly priced sandwiches that are strictly the best i can find in SF. People talk up Ike's a lot, but the wait for a sandwich is ridiculous and just not nearly as tasty or well constructed as Mr. pickles. Excellent service, family run and all around a great place. it would be nice if they had more seating though. if you want my recommendation, get the #19.
author: J. G.

description: meh is right. mediocre at best. it's edible. and the woman (who was adorably batty) just wasn't listening when i told her what i didn't want on the sandwich... so i ended up with most of the stuff i didn't want. oh well.
author: Ashley A.

description: awesome veggie sandwiches, make sure to get dutch crunch!
author: Dave M.

description: I love this place!  It is a great addition to the neighborhood.  I especially like the fact that they hire neighborhood folks to help run the place.  And to top it all off...the sandwiches are FANTASTIC!  I recommend any on the menu, as I have tried almost every one.  If you are part of a school or community group, ask about discounts.  They really try to support the neighborhood.
author: Jason W.

description: I went by here five times before i went in, but i should have listened to Mr. Pickle's look in his 2 dimensional eyes long before. I didn't know that pesto was meant to be on all sanwishes, but it is.  well, maybe not all.  that's why no 5 stars.  One of two places to get real sandwish in the mission.  This sandwish is two meals for me.  making my meal 3.50 each time.  This is the rad price for the rad meal.
author: chreesh b.

description: I come here for a fantastic sandwich. I don't go for the amazingly cheap price, that is just a bonus.
author: Kelly J.

description: Great sandwiches! I wish I live closer to them  :-(
author: Lysander A.

description: Although their sandwich are expensive, i still love how it taste. $7 a sandwich is more than what i can afford for lunch but i'll go when i have a buck more to spare.
author: Man G.

description:
hey very good sandwiches
#1 mr. pickles shop
Also Upset someone stole the MR PIckle outside the one with the hat and the sandwich in his hands so whoever took it please give it back to the store owner
author: Suleiman J.

description: Live just a few steps away and never walked in til a friend mentioned how good the sandwiches are. Oh Yeah! Totally agree! The sandwich is huge and the guys did not go weighing or conserve the portions like some mu*&th%$$ckin shops do like weak a$$ Togos or Subway which are multi-million $$ companies. Prices are fair for the amount of sandwich you get and so I highly recommend. Thanks to those guys who hook it up in there! Oh yea - who the F*&&ck took Mr. Pickles! Bring em back!
author: Edward B.

description: The lady that runs this place is great! And I love their sandwiches!
author: Mr. Marie T.

description: We really enjoyed our sandwiches here! It's a great place to find something for everyone in a group and you don't have to spend a lot. I got a chicken type sandwich and really enjoyed it. My wife tried the veggie type sandwich and she's asked if we can go back sometime. If you're in the area and only want to spend 6-7 bucks on lunch, I'd recommend stopping here.
author: Devin B.

description: I live across the street from Mr. Pickles and only go there once in a while for a treat.  I love their BLT on Dutch Crunch.  I love deli sandwiches and the people here are low key and nice.  Recommended.
author: Walter P.

description: i live in the neighborhood and you really couldn't ask for more in a sandwich.  i like the veggie sandwich - the pesto gives it a nice kick and.  the mean sandwiches are really good too.  they use a lot of different fresh veggies and the bread is good as well.  try one of their sandwiches warm!
author: michelle k.

description: I must admit that this place can make a killer sandwich. Their bread is always perfectly toasted. Anytime, I show up I can get a sandwich real quick no appointments or waiting. Street parking is not bad either. If your ever in the area, try them out they sure beat your quizno's
author: Aaron W.

description: great sandwiches, great price.  depending on your appetite, likely enough food for 2 meals.  have tried just about every chicken sandwich and have not been disappointed yet.
author: Tim G.
